020bfa5a-2947-44b4-b6cf-c92c290983fa: A hexcrafter magus adds all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of 6th level or lower that have the curse descriptor to his spellbook.
6a5b9336-0e54-4151-a19f-5470944245a0: A hexcrafter magus has uncovered the secret of using his arcane pool to recreate witch hexes. These magi can hex friend and foe, curse those they strike, and expand their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} selection to include many curses and harmful spells.
5dcf6faf-c269-4a34-b560-bc6f4a9886c7: A hexcrafter may select any witch hex in place of a magus arcana. At 12th level, the hexcrafter may select a hex or major hex in place of a magus arcana. At 18th level, a hexcrafter can select a hex, major hex, or grand hex in place of a magus arcana.
75f43f22-a9fe-4b3d-9823-a129345d4091: A magus is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}. A magus is also proficient with light armor. He can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus wearing medium armor, heavy armor, or a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure. A multiclass magus still incurs the normal arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes.
b3e5e24f-08ab-44e9-80fe-a5d85fd53da3: A number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the magus's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus
38e5be20-200f-43a5-ac22-ff314d64889b:
A sword saint is proficient in {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and in a single martial or exotic melee weapon of his choice. A sword saint is not proficient with armor or shields and suffers normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} when casting magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while armored.
At 1st level, a sword saint gains Weapon Focus with his chosen weapon as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
ccf8db54-dd79-4ae2-a336-cf6157f84190: A sword saint spends his life focusing his training and meditation into a rapturous perfection of the use of a single weapon, which is usually but not always a sword, channeling his arcane might through it in a dizzying and deadly dance beyond the abilities of even the greatest of mundane warriors.
da23d1e1-c7af-4cc5-8eb2-12187edaa275: An arcane rider can use dimensional ride as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} now. After teleporting, the arcane rider and his mount companion gain the effect of the haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the arcane rider's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus.
02feeeee-996b-439b-b51f-ca2206edf3be: An arcane rider gains an opportunity to spend 1 point from his arcane pool and a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to transfer himself and his mount companion from his current location to any other spot within a 30-foot range.
e874d6b6-d4e7-479b-a8c2-7f12df528c31: An arcane rider may select mounted combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as bonus feats.
ac4ebe17-5dc6-469b-85ff-6f825dca49a2: An arcane rider's abilities that spend arcane pool also apply to his mount companion.
c7def1d0-a0be-49a2-8ff6-86d4c6e5c1b0:
An armored battlemage cannot spend points from his arcane pool to enhance weapons. Instead, he can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant armor he is wearing a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every 4 magus levels he has beyond 1st, the armor gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses stack with existing armor enhancement bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following armor special abilities: balanced, bitter, fortification (heavy, light, or medium), ghost touch, invulnerability, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, or 19), or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} storing.
Adding these {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} consumes an amount of bonus equal to the ability's base price modifier. In addition, the armored battlemage can grant his armor the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} special ability at the cost of a +3 bonus or the improved energy resistance special ability at the cost of a +5 bonus. These special abilities are added to any the armor already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the armor is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the armored battlemage uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the armor is worn by anyone other than the magus.
1ae7f1c4-45ce-42f6-a95a-84d3cdfa3c75: An armored battlemage gains this ability at 1st level instead of 7th. When wearing medium armor, the armored battlemage gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}. This stacks with the bonus from the Combat Casting {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
e71286e7-6154-4ff3-b485-793ffda53547: An armored battlemage gains this ability at 7th level instead of 13th.
4fdee392-3d64-4bff-a731-7d1bc29d767e: As he gains levels, a magus learns arcane secrets tailored to his specific way of blending martial puissance and magical skill. Starting at 3rd level, a magus gains one magus arcana. He gains an additional magus arcana for every three levels of magus attained after 3rd level. Unless specifically noted in a magus arcana's description, a magus cannot select a particular magus arcana more than once.
0d951d5a-91f9-49b4-b503-2c627e14b398: As shadow, except it grants a +15 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
d5321758-382e-414f-92d4-2d153c15ac41: At 11th level, a sword saint can make a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} in a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (minimum 1). This effect stacks with the Combat Reflexes {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
15413ad1-affd-4194-8760-b8cdf52446ed: At 11th level, the magus's ability to recall {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} using his arcane pool becomes more efficient. Whenever he recalls a spell with spell recall, he expends a number of points from his arcane pool equal to 1/2 the spell's level (minimum 1).
546467d0-3073-4cef-a030-70fe8e1e57aa: At 13th level, a magus gains proficiency with heavy armor. A magus can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing heavy armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus using a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure.
c99cef32-13f7-4c1d-8ac3-eb0aaf4ffb98: At 13th level, when a sword saint is attacking a {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} opponent, he adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with his chosen weapon (minimum 0).
22afddac-4092-457d-acd4-1633c98c7e95: At 13th level, while wearing light armor or no armor, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer's insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} increases to +4.
ed65a903-5967-4359-967a-37ba6613b3ac: At 14th level, the magus gains the ability to seamlessly cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}. Whenever he uses the spell combat ability, his {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} bonus from Improved Spell Combat increases to +4.
bcffd31a-ea7b-47d5-a442-caca6d163cb4: At 16th level, whenever an enemy within {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of the magus successfully casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} defensively, that enemy provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the magus after the spell is complete.
17a59bb9-7a01-4241-a6cc-fa3480c2a20f: At 19th level, a sword saint's {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} is automatically a natural 20.
3bd03d47-2193-425c-bf84-bdf8eb2265ef: At 19th level, the magus gains access to an expanded {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list. He learns 6 spells of any levels from 1st to 6th from the wizard's spell list and places them into his spellbook as magus spells of their wizard level.
642e0bdc-6f90-4811-846f-030d77920b3f:
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or speed.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.
0f2ffcc4-5d8e-47f8-8bdd-85c532bb0cdd: At 1st level, a magus learns to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and wield his weapons at the same time. This functions much like two-weapon fighting, but the off-hand weapon is a spell that is being cast. To use this ability, the magus must have one hand free, while wielding a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} melee weapon in the other hand. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, he can make all of his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with his melee weapon at a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and can also cast any spell from the magus spell list with a {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} (any attack roll made as part of this spell also takes this penalty).
5179b421-32ae-4d6b-9e78-49dbd88e7683: At 1st level, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer gains the ability to expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to gain a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his movement rate and a +2 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the spell dancer gains another +10 enhancement bonus to movement and +2 to AC against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity. At 5th level, once per spell dance as a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, the spell dancer may use blur or haste on himself as a swift action. These abilities last for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At 9th level, the spell dancer may instead take a swift action to use dimension door as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} once during a spelldance. At 13th level, the spell dancer may instead choose to take a swift action to gain freedom of movement for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds.
019a1f4c-5aca-4ab2-be6b-7558d4b2393e:
At 1st level, the magus gains a reservoir of mystical arcane energy that he can draw upon to fuel his powers and enhance his weapon. This arcane pool has a number of points equal to 1/2 his magus level (minimum 1) + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. The pool refreshes once per day when the magus prepares his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or speed.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.
cca54c6d-67b4-4835-a719-e5ad25c85392: At 20th level, any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} a sword saint makes with his chosen weapon automatically confirm all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats and have their {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} multiplier increased by 1 (×2 becomes ×3, for example).
8e366c4d-5bb5-49f1-9f36-3cddc9f1c215:
At 20th level, the magus becomes a master of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and combat. Whenever he uses his spell combat ability, he does not need to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} to cast the spell defensively.
Whenever the magus uses spell combat, he can choose to either increase the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist his spells{/g} by 2, grant himself a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on any {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome spell resistance, or grant himself a +2 circumstance bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}.
8f41f1b1-4376-46dd-90fa-44374483280d:
At 2nd level, whenever a magus casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with a range of "touch" from the magus spell list, he can deliver the spell through any weapon he is wielding as part of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}.
Instead of the free melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} normally allowed to deliver the spell, a magus can make one free melee attack with his weapon (at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}) as part of casting this spell. If successful, this melee attack deals its normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as well as the effects of the spell. If the magus makes this {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in concert with spell combat, this melee attack takes all the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} accrued by spell combat melee attacks.
This attack uses the weapon's {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} range (20, 19–20, or 18–20 and modified by the keen weapon property or similar effects), but the spell effect only deals ×2 damage on a successful critical hit, while the weapon damage uses its own critical modifier.
17c64d19-165c-49d9-b8c0-c8a9131fe380: At 2nd level, whenever an eldritch archer casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that calls for a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g}, she can deliver the spell through a ranged weapon she wields as part of a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Instead of the free ranged attack normally allowed to deliver the spell, an eldritch archer can make one free ranged attack with a ranged weapon (at her highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}) as part of casting this spell. The attack does not increase the spell's range.
1727cde1-589e-4db6-8499-919fca1899ee:
At 3rd level, an armored battlemage gains armor training, as per the fighter ability.
At 8th level, he gains armor training 2.
At 13th level, he gains armor training 3.
At 18th level, he gains armor training 4.
62be88f0-d42a-48e6-9768-000a5e88fd73:
At 4th level, the hexcrafter magus gains access to a small number of witch's hexes. The hexcrafter magus picks one hex from the witch's hex class feature. He gains the benefit of or uses that hex as if he were a witch of a level equal to his magus level.
This feature replaces {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} recall.
a9d5dc1f-553b-46b4-a1de-75f3180bb96a: At 4th level, the magus learns to use his arcane pool to recall {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} he has already cast. With a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} he can recall any single magus spell that he has already prepared and cast that day by expending a number of points from his arcane pool equal to the spell's level (minimum 1). The spell is prepared again, just as if it had not been cast.
dcc16fc0-3867-4a45-be80-8afc77b1ffc6: At 4th level, when a sword saint confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, he can spend 1 point from his arcane pool to increase his weapon's critical multiplier by 1.
bc386a64-4f83-4ee7-a76e-fa0944eb22a0: At 4th level, when a sword saint hits with his chosen weapon, he can spend 1 point from his arcane pool in order to maximize his weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Don't {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} for damage — the weapon deals maximum damage. This affects only the weapon's base damage dice, not additional damage from sneak attack, magical weapon properties, spellstrike, or {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}.
3eddd1e6-433f-43df-b7db-15df027a6ca4: At 4th level, when a sword saint hits with his chosen weapon, he can spend 1 point from his arcane pool in order to maximize his weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Don't {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} for damage — the weapon deals maximum damage. This affects only the weapon's base damage dice, not additional damage from sneak attack, magical weapon properties, spellstrike, or {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. If the sword saint confirms a critical hit, he can instead spend 2 points from his arcane pool to increase his weapon's critical multiplier by 1.
d9cbb3d2-3ea3-465d-a6cd-41e97f407f67: At 5th level, and every six levels thereafter, a magus gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as combat or magic feats. He must meet the prerequisites for these feats as normal.
bcc702bf-3047-4e4c-b697-0ad9a021cbd7: At 5th level, whenever a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer casts a magus spell, he gains a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to the spell's level until the beginning of his next turn.
1080431f-2dab-4115-b39e-ad19b185ad47: At 7th level, a magus gains proficiency with medium armor. A magus can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing medium armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus wearing heavy armor or using a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure.
f63620d5-f053-45ee-acf3-a8d4ab21597c: At 7th level, a sword saint applies his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier as well as his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} (minimum 0).
fe68346b-ca78-4285-8c12-d875b390fb56: At 7th level, while wearing light armor or no armor, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer gains a +2 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
8f35a234-952f-410d-98ba-a6946cfa7699: At 8th level, the magus's ability to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} improves. When using the spell combat ability, the magus receives a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}.
0712d022-0b00-4f7a-9f6d-cc9c5deaee82:
At 9th level, a sword saint adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus (minimum 0) on {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} with his chosen weapon.
In addition, the sword saint may use his magus levels in place of his {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonuses{/g} to qualify for any {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} for which it is a prerequisite.
f7842c42-3c49-4c44-aa17-79f6a4d35096:
Each eldrich scion has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, an eldrich scion might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the eldrich scion gains levels. An eldrich scion must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of eldrich scion. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing — or a curse. For some eldrich scions, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, an eldrich scion learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, an eldrich scion receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The eldrich scion must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.
4806db3e-7fe9-49ab-a95d-a74e301ce0c2: Instead of a melee weapon, an eldritch archer must use a ranged weapon for {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} combat. She doesn't need a free hand for ranged spell combat. The eldritch archer cannot accept an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} to cast a spell defensively.
3f59c142-b923-4e2b-aede-d94516eb2d21: Magi can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
9c7dd2ab-80a7-4fe9-ae32-20a38354cc3f: Magi spend much of their time traveling the world, learning whatever martial or arcane secrets they can find. They might spend months learning a new sword-fighting style from a master warrior, while simultaneously moonlighting in the local library, poring through tomes of ancient lore. Most who take this path dabble in all sorts of lore, picking up anything that might aid them in their search for perfection.
9816cf65-126e-4dca-a9bd-5d6033c2b208: Magus is an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcaster{/g} who fights with a weapon in one hand and a spell in the other. They are very effective attackers thanks to a vast array of both offensive and defensive spells. However, playing this class takes a lot of attention and micromanagement.
6f3b125a-b4d2-46f1-8803-52d1681e2f51: Magus possesses a pool of arcane energy that allows them to empower their weapons, restore spent {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, and use other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}.
e890a67e-ac8d-4a4a-87aa-9402952fda8f: Many battlemages focus purely on destructive evocations, but some extend their tactical studies to include use of the tried-and-true protection of steel. These armored battlemages learn to move and cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} in even the most restrictive armors, and have developed new methods to magically enhance their armor.
91a4a397-b50e-496e-83af-46cedee864dd: Starting at 10th level, a magus counts 1/2 his total magus level as his fighter level for the purpose of qualifying for {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If he has levels in fighter, these levels stack.
58b9694d-9c9c-4890-98d2-dc9d713bd915: Starting at 7th level, a sword saint counts his sword saint level –3 as his fighter level for the purpose of qualifying for {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If he has levels in fighter, these levels stack.
4ca0686c-8103-479f-9595-99c06e135b07: The eldritch archer rains magical attacks down on her foes.
b829f178-b346-44b1-9766-9847a8c58799:
The magus can add the anarchic property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
An anarchic weapon is infused with the power of chaos. It makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotic-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of lawful alignment.
f2b92a33-7056-40d1-a3e7-f57c95593f5e:
The magus can add the axiomatic property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
An axiomatic weapon is infused with lawful power. It makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against creatures of chaotic alignment.
6650c960-b6ec-46b7-8b4f-95a77c1d19fb:
The magus can add the brilliant energy property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 4 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A brilliant energy weapon ignores nonliving matter. Armor and shield bonuses to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (including any enhancement bonuses to that armor) do not count against it because the weapon passes through armor. ({g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, deflection, dodge, natural armor, and other such bonuses still apply.) A brilliant energy weapon cannot harm undead, constructs, or objects.
c7b63599-5388-44d9-9745-9ec876a21bc2:
The magus can add the flaming property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A flaming weapon is sheathed in fire that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. The fire does not harm the wielder.
af295e07-f8f1-4886-acd6-655b570a378a:
The magus can add the frost property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A frost weapon is sheathed in a terrible, icy cold that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} on a successful hit. The cold does not harm the wielder.
93f8dc3c-5e92-454c-9275-3cb010b86237:
The magus can add the ghost touch property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A ghost touch weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally against incorporeal creatures, regardless of its bonus. An incorporeal creature's 50% reduction in damage from corporeal sources does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made against it with ghost touch weapons.
b1bb308b-bfe2-4c63-b3ce-74e67532c534:
The magus can add the holy property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A holy weapon is imbued with holy power. This power makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of evil alignment.
58f06e48-d1a0-4d0f-9e21-eb2fd532cfb5:
The magus can add the keen property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
The keen property doubles the threat range of a weapon. This benefit doesn't stack with any other effects that expand the threat range of a weapon (such as the keen edge {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or the Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}).
7949d0c8-e5af-4c65-9c43-0a0aee2c1dde:
The magus can add the shock property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A shock weapon is sheathed in crackling electricity that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} on a successful hit. The electricity does not harm the wielder.
da5e0980-3df6-4b1d-9cea-ba7a6ecc6b50:
The magus can add the speed property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 3 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, the wielder of a speed weapon may make one extra attack with it. The attack uses the wielder's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This benefit is not cumulative with similar effects, such as a haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.)
dc0b32d6-746c-4a99-a574-3965525505d9:
The magus can add the unholy property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
An unholy weapon is imbued with unholy power. This power makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of good alignment.
551fb73e-d144-46f0-a8c2-1ec95bf6d532: The magus can cast three {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} per day as if those spells were modified by the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
2c0acb29-bde2-489e-97c3-bcfa66369c23: The magus can cast three {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} per day as if those spells were modified by the Extend Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
f876f04f-fbff-4315-840f-da1fddf4abb4: The magus can cast three {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} per day as if those spells were modified by the Maximize Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
53844b79-dad4-4fd3-ae01-d9bf416d48ec: The magus can cast three {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} per day as if those spells were modified by the Quicken Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
ccf0c337-75eb-4ae1-bacb-751d1a7289e5: The magus can cast three {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} per day as if those spells were modified by the Reach Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
2fca1af9-5bd8-4773-ba98-fbc0008439df: The magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, allowing him to anticipate his opponent's defenses. Enemies are denied their {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus against the magus's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} until the end of the magus's next turn.
b9183d35-2036-4dd8-b311-e85cf5e3d4ea: The magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant himself an insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} until the end of his turn.
cd6a99a8-df48-4ce2-bd0f-d335c18cb49d: The magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to move more quickly. This functions as haste, but only targets the magus and lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the magus's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus.
01ef5dcb-60cb-4038-9330-fa867160fc6a: The magus can expend 2 points from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to resolve all of his melee weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} until the end of his turn as melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g}.
67305378-4cdd-458f-957d-6925a8b3ca32:
The magus can spend 1 additional point to add the bane property to a weapon enhanced with his arcane pool. All enemies count as designated foes for this weapon.
A bane weapon excels against certain foes. Against a designated foe, the weapon's enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} is +2 better than its actual bonus. It also deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against such foes.
eea791ef-ffc6-4e87-9970-55ea4b9d5400: The magus can activate a wand or staff in place of casting a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} when using spell combat.
1e66858f-b9bf-4118-af26-12326ec1026a: The strong emphasis on wizards within elven culture influences how even non-wizard elves see themselves. Many elven magi do not consider themselves masters of a blend of martial and magical talents, but rather a sub-category of wizards who study the effect of physical movement and techniques upon {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} ability. They believe their ability to cast spells while fighting is an outgrowth of the concept of the "spell dance", which itself is just another kind of wizardry.
f88e2406-2f47-4eb1-908c-680158d7adda:
The subject's outline appears blurred, shifting, and wavering. This distortion grants the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20% miss chance).
A see invisibility {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} does not counteract the blur effect, but a true seeing spell does.
Opponents that cannot see the subject ignore the spell's effect (though fighting an unseen opponent carries {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} of its own).
294b811e-a6a4-4585-b22a-16895cd38c49: This ability allows the magus to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} within the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. It can't be used if the magus has their both hands full.
b9408995-6fd5-416d-ab3f-f087030c7b4a: This ability can charge a weapon with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that requires a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, and then deliver it by attacking the enemy with that weapon.
32c68782-781e-4e97-b87a-7b7cef023bdc: This armor blurs the wearer whenever she tries to hide, while also dampening the sound around her, granting a +5 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. The armor's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} still applies normally.
a7afcb83-2851-4f22-87bc-17c354a7655b: This armor pushes back against anything that threatens to knock its wearer to the ground. The wearer gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against grapple, trip and overrun {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
af963b8a-d3f2-4016-ba76-2e5b30112b2a: This armor pushes back against anything that threatens to knock its wearer to the ground. The wearer gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against grapple, trip and overrun {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
dc793be4-81c4-4722-9f05-f5917fdf3d45: This suit of armor grants the wearer {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/magic.
a5c4a34e-3454-493e-800b-62c6f8e2bfd2: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} enables you or a creature you {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} to move and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} normally for the duration of the spell, even under the influence of magic that usually impedes movement, such as paralysis, solid fog, slow, and web. All {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to grapple the target automatically fail.
42a50fc2-7aae-4894-9455-68131ca4470c: Unlike typical magi, eldritch scions do not study tomes of magic or spend time learning to combine martial and magical skills. Rather, eldritch scions find that their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities come to them instinctively.
247aa028-29fa-4003-a391-9594d9d807aa: When a magus gains a special bond with his mount, he becomes an arcane rider. The magus and his faithful companion not only begin to think as one, but literally become a single arcane entity — they share one arcane pool and can move through dimensions together, plunging enemies into confusion with sudden attacks from nowhere.
cbb1a1ed-16a0-4853-a351-3fbf920ece3c: When wearing light or no armor, wielding his chosen weapon, and not using a shield, a sword saint adds 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus (if any) per magus {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} as a dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. If a sword saint is caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} or otherwise denied her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus, she also loses this bonus.
441c2596-07b8-49bf-9a71-3d6f7667c0ab: Whenever the magus enchants his weapon using his arcane pool, he may spend 1 additional point from his arcane pool to increase the duration of the enchantment to 1 minute per magus level.
30129d01-1b0b-410c-b81f-b78ca53d6fec: Whenever the magus enchants his weapon using his arcane pool, he may spend 1 additional point from his arcane pool to increase the duration of the enchantment to 1 minute per magus level.
9e3767dc-130a-441d-be7b-843da67466bd: Whenever the magus enhances his weapon using his arcane pool, he adds the anarchic, axiomatic, holy, or unholy special abilities to the list of available options. A magus may only add one of these abilities if it matches his own {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}.
680e86bb-724d-43a5-8087-ec7f4024f038: Whenever the magus enhances his weapon using his arcane pool, he adds the brilliant energy and ghost touch special abilities to the list of available options.
4c3c3c2e-c9af-471e-968f-09b41574ad75: Whenever the magus enhances his weapon using his arcane pool, he may spend 1 additional point from his arcane pool to add the bane special ability to the weapon.
32bd5dd2-3309-49bb-af27-2a19f4ed8dfa: Whenever the magus uses a wand, he calculates the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} it contains using his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier, instead of the minimum modifier needed to cast a spell of that level.
ed441369-3e81-4d0a-893f-1a81ca3bea3e: Whenever the magus uses {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} combat, he can choose to grant himself a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}.
86d31c57-0b30-4dba-9039-4aa5f1e84023: Whenever the magus uses {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} combat, he can choose to grant himself a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on any {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
4c81c52d-d189-42bd-89f2-b6bfa85053fd: Whenever the magus uses {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} combat, he can choose to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to resist his spells by 2.
68b7bd11-5337-4e26-becb-fe1add966db6: You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You may also bring with you all friendly creatures within a 10-foot radius around you.
